image.altText: helicopter porepunkah

props.synopsis: The search for a man alleged to have killed two police officers on a rural property near Porepunkah in Victoria's north-east enters its fourth day. Follow live.

title.children: Search for alleged Porepunkah gunman enters fourth day

image.altText: Two middle-aged to women sit in the front seats of a van, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: There are calls for more public transport in the regions as South Gippsland residents find ways to get to where they need to go.

title.children: Residents create public transport oasis in train and bus 'desert'

image.altText: A skier in the distance on a snowy mountain

props.synopsis: Victoria's alpine region braces for one of the season's most significant snowfalls, amid the ongoing search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman.

title.children: Snow enthusiasts told to stay away as Porepunkah manhunt continues

image.altText: A young man in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: A 27-year-old Korumburra man has been sentenced to nine and a half years in prison after killing 21-year-old Jake Bradford in January 2023 when he attacked, stripped, robbed and ran over his victim in a car.

title.children: Kayle Hansen sentenced to nine years for manslaughter of Jake Bradford

image.altText: The picture of a girl wearing a red school blazer and glasses

props.synopsis: Year 7 student Milla Killeen was killed and more than 20 children taken to hospital when the Christian College Geelong bus rolled near Geelong on Wednesday morning. Her family has issued a statement saying she had the 'whole world in front of her'.

title.children: Family describes victim of school bus rollover as 'a beautiful soul'

image.altText: Six residents from Mount Atkinson stand with development plan leaflets

props.synopsis: Residents in Melbourne's booming outer west say developers have failed to deliver on their initial sales pitches — prompting a push for tighter restrictions on the way new communities are advertised.

title.children: Promised town centre in limbo years after residents bought into new suburb

image.altText: Manfred looks affectionately at a joey nestled in a fabric pouch in his arms.

props.synopsis: Regional Victorian wildlife groups are worried kangaroo collisions are at record levels and urge stronger wildlife planning in new housing developments.

title.children: Kangaroo vehicle collisions at record high in Victoria

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The risk posed by the sovereign citizen movement in Australia has concerned experts and authorities for years. Now it may have become a reality, after two police officers were allegedly killed by a man who identifies with the group.

title.children: The sovereign citizen movement is no longer 'fringe' since the pandemic

image.altText: A photo down Tara's main street featuring the Tara Cafe and Commercial Hotel, December 2022.

props.synopsis: In the wake of another rural police shooting, Queensland's Tara and Wieambilla community members share what helped them in their darkest days.

title.children: Qld communities 'very similar' to Porepunkah reach out with advice

image.altText: A mid-shot of West Coast Eagles coach Adam Simpson on ground with a blue and yellow team jumper on, looking upwards.

props.synopsis: Mitch Brown's former West Coast coach, Adam Simpson, admits he has reflected on the locker-room culture at the club under his tenure since Brown became the AFL's first openly bisexual player.

title.children: Mitch Brown's former West Coast coach reflects on AFL locker-room culture

image.altText: Coach Nathan Burke looks on during a Western Bulldogs AFLW training session.

props.synopsis: Former Western Bulldogs AFLW coach Nathan Burke says the league's continued vetoing of trades involving expansion is contributing to the current competitive imbalance in the competition.

title.children: League blocked trades that didn't benefit expansion clubs claims former AFLW coach

image.altText: A storm looms over Djuritte (Mount Arapiles) in Western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Spring is shaping up to be warm and wet for large parts of country as warm seas off WA's north-west kick a major climate driver into gear.

title.children: BOM forecasts wet spring as severe storm barrels towards nation's south

image.altText: A 59-year-old man stands on a rural property with his dog looking happy.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police has named Detective Leading Constable Neal Thompson and Senior Constable Vadim De Waart as the two officers who were killed at a property in Victoria's north-east yesterday.

title.children: What we know about the two police officers shot dead in Porepunkah

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: Dezi Freeman, the 56-year-old Porepunkah man wanted over the fatal shooting of two police officers, last year complained to a court that he had his firearms licence cancelled and lost membership to his gun club.

title.children: Suspected Porepunkah gunman complained of losing gun licence last year

image.altText: Gordan lights a small fire

props.synopsis: Authorities admit alleged Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman knows the bush better than they do, and a survival expert has warned he could remain on the run for weeks depending on his skills and training.

title.children: Suspect could survive 'weeks' in bush, survivalist says

image.altText: Porepunkah primary school sign

props.synopsis: Businesses, offices and the school in the High Country hamlet of Porepunkah remain closed, and residents are being told to stay inside until the alleged gunman is found.

title.children: Fearful residents of mountain town stunned as shooting drama unfolds

image.altText: A photo of a boy with short hair wearing a black jacket with hands together and a woman with black hair cuddling him

props.synopsis: Conan Smith lit his Victorian home on fire before causing a crash that killed him and his son, three days after the boy's mother died from cancer.

title.children: Father deliberately caused crash that killed him and his son, 7

image.altText: A man wearing a hate poses in front of a bathroom mirror.

props.synopsis: Harley Caldwell faces the Mildura Magistrates’ Court to have his bail conditions varied so he can watch streaming services and use the internet for banking and medical services.

title.children: Court allows teacher facing child abuse material charges back on internet

image.altText: Mitchell Brown shouts at the crowd after a goal during a West Coast Eagles AFL game.

props.synopsis: Mitch Brown's historic announcement as the first publicly bisexual current or former male AFL player is met with support from across the sporting world.

title.children: 'Our boys will be proud': Praise for Brown after ex-AFL player's historic announcement

image.altText: A firefighter fights a blaze at Yanchep.

props.synopsis: Parts of Western Australia, South Australia and Victoria will see increased fire risk this spring, as emergency services unveil their outlook for the season.

title.children: Spring bushfire outlook points to busy season for emergency services

image.altText: Three firefighters outside a building which has orange flames coming from the roof at night.

props.synopsis: A man charged over the firebombing of a Melbourne synagogue faces court a day after the prime minister and ASIO officials say the incident is linked to the Iranian government.

title.children: Man charged over Melbourne synagogue firebombing faces court

image.altText: rural road with fence

props.synopsis: A 1,360-home housing estate in the Macedon Ranges is approved by the Victorian government, but nearby residents fear it will change the character of their town.

title.children: Fast-tracked housing estate angers country Victoria town

image.altText: Will sitting at a coffee shop with a pot of tea in front of him.

props.synopsis: A delinquent teenager has been ordered to serve more than seven years behind bars for killing a man in a high-speed crash in Melbourne's south-east last year.

title.children: Teenage driver cries as judge jails him over deadly, high-speed crash

image.altText: A composite image of West Coast's Harley Reid and St Kilda's Nasaiah Wanganeen-Milera.

props.synopsis: Harley Reid has confounded the speculation with his decision to stay in the west, but for players like him and Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera, the ferocious media spotlight is never likely to abate.

title.children: Harley and Nasiah's mega-deals only pause AFL's descent into new media world

props.synopsis: Iran was behind at least two antisemitic attacks on Australian soil, ASIO believes.

title.children: Australia expels Iranian ambassador after ASIO says it directed antisemitic attacks

image.altText: Brownlow Medal

props.synopsis: Investigators say the four men collectively broke the law dozens of times, using corrupt conduct information to gamble on the 2021 and 2022 Brownlow medal awards.

title.children: Four men charged over alleged AFL Brownlow Medal betting scheme

image.altText: A sketch in tones of cream and brown of a woman with long hair standing with her arms by her side, frowning.

props.synopsis: The convicted triple-murderer faced lunch survivor Ian Wilkinson and her victims' loved ones during an emotional pre-sentence hearing in Melbourne on Monday.

title.children: Prosecutor wants jail with no parole for mushroom murderer Erin Patterson

image.altText: Greg McMahon stands in front of a wired fence on the perimeter of the Rossdale Golf Course.

props.synopsis: Some community members in Melbourne's south-east are fighting plans to sell a privately-owned golf course used by the public, as the club behind it grapples with growing debt.

title.children: Residents up in arms over plans to sell a Melbourne golf course to developers

image.altText: A data centre

props.synopsis: A council in Melbourne's outer north has voted for more scrutiny over applications for resource-intensive data centres, with its deputy mayor warning the significant volumes of water they require could jeopardise new housing and population growth.

title.children: Council sounds alarm on 'tidal wave' of data centre water applications

image.altText: Burnt rubble of a house behind police tape.

props.synopsis: David Cartledge has admitted to lighting the fire that killed his housemate in 2023.

title.children: Man admits to lighting fatal house fire near Mildura

image.altText: Man sitting in a ute, with sheep in the background.

props.synopsis: The effects of drought linger, but the season has taken a turn for the better in western Victoria, where above-average rainfall is forecast for spring.

title.children: Spring forecast brings optimism and relief as Victorian drought eases

image.altText: Kelpie leaps over sheep

props.synopsis: A study estimates the nation's 270,000 working livestock dogs contributed to the economy at an amount similar to Australia's beef exports to the US in 2023-24.

title.children: Working dogs worth billions to the Australian economy

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: Police allege the South Yarra man targeted a local synagogue six times this year.

title.children: Man charged with multiple graffiti attacks on Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera while her left hip is being tattooed.

props.synopsis: Member for Mildura Jade Benham has had the image of a vanilla slice tattooed on her hip, in support of a local event and small business.

title.children: Nationals MP takes vanilla slice support to new level with tattoo

image.altText: Chris Flinos

props.synopsis: A crypto CEO accused of fraud in Abu Dhabi is now working at a suburban mortgage broker in Melbourne.

title.children: The collapsed crypto boss now working at a Melbourne mortgage broker
